intro: Pilosella duerkhemiensis, commonly known as the Duerkhemiense Goatsbeard, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories or rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The small, yellow flowers bloom in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value in certain horticultural settings.
